THIRUVANANTHAPURAM

Thiruvananthapuram, also known as Trivandrum, is the capital city and the largest district of Kerala. It is a place where you can enjoy the natural beauty, the historical heritage, and the cultural diversity of Kerala. Here are some of the tourist attractions in Thiruvananthapuram district that you can visit:

Padmanabhaswamy Temple: This is one of the most famous and sacred Hindu pilgrimage sites in India, dedicated to Lord Vishnu, who is worshipped as Padmanabha, or the one who reclines on the serpent Ananta. The temple is one of the 108 Divya Desams, or holy abodes of Lord Vishnu, and is known for its magnificent architecture, mural paintings, and gold-plated covering. The temple also has a mysterious vault, which is believed to contain immense wealth and treasures

Napier Museum: This is a museum that showcases the art, culture, and history of Kerala. It was established in 1855, and named after Lord Napier, the former governor of Madras. The museum has a collection of various items, such as sculptures, paintings, weapons, coins, musical instruments, and ivory carvings. The museum also has a natural history section, which displays various specimens of animals, birds, and plants. The museum is also known for its Indo-Saracenic style of architecture, with a Gothic roof, stained glass windows, and a garden

Kovalam Beach: This is one of the most popular beaches in Kerala, with golden sand, clear water, and coconut palms. You can sunbathe, swim, surf, or indulge in some adventure sports at this beach, or simply enjoy the sunset and the sea breeze. The beach also has a lighthouse, which offers a panoramic view of the Arabian Sea and the city. The beach is also known for its Ayurvedic centres, which offer various treatments and massages

Shanghumukham Beach: This is another serene and beautiful beach in Thiruvananthapuram, ideal for relaxing and rejuvenating. It is a long and wide stretch of sand, with clear water and gentle waves. It is also a good place for swimming, boating, and fishing. The beach has a sculpture garden, a children’s park, and a war memorial nearby. The beach is also the venue for the annual sand art festival, which showcases the creativity and talent of the sand artists
